positive.review: The game is great and all, but there are 2 points that got under my skin. 1- Customers that buy a 2 dollar worth of items and pay with 100, leading the player to have to give them 98 dollars change which is annoying to deal with. 2- In Co-op, as a guest player, If you try to buy the storage for the first time it unlocks normally, but after ending the session and starting it again, it asks you to buy the storage again even though it is already unlocked, resulting in spending 800 dollars over nothing which I suppose is some sort of bug or glitch in the game's development, but the Co-op is relatively new so it is expected to have these kinds of issues. I just wanted to report this bug before anyone ends up going through the same and getting surprised by this bug/glitch.
i come home from my real job and then clock in to my fake job it's just non stop at this point (except the fake job is actually fun)

For a sim game that's about managing a supermarket, it's a pretty chill game that's mildly grindy but isn't too in your face about it. You can go at it at your own pace, which is nice compared to how it actually works in real life.

Very nice, but ...

- bad performance (especially for this kind of game)
- buggy mutliplayer
- weird decision with lobbies hosted on their servers
- progression needs to be rebalanced
- jank driving physics

still a lot of fun, can recommend.

Easily one of the simulation game that manages to hold you for hours without getting bored. It start a little bit slow, but gets you through after a couple of hours. Pretty much advised with co-op as it gets more fun and easy to handle.

a few bugs still here and there but seeing how this game as improved from how it used to be a year ago to now is crazy. very fun game, very chill for playing something while you watch something. love it!

I do recommend this game for single player mode.  I can't recommend multiplayer, as there are too many bugs and glitches.  Category signs reset after each session, lag between players makes us not see the same thing on each other's screens, employees and checkout counters showing up when they're not actually there, phantom boxes on shelves creating stuck labels, etc..  

Initially, I'd nominated this game for the relaxing game category, but I feel like there are far too many things that could be fixed, whether playing alone or with a friend.  I don't feel very relaxed when I can't tell my restockers to take a break while I reorganize shelves.
Great game with lots of potential . I enjoyed it but i hope the devs release more updates.
This is one of the best simulators I've played in my entire experience as a gamer. Don't hesitate, just download it, you won't regret it.

Multiplayer is awesome addition to the game. Playing together is so much fun. Multiplayer has some buggs, for example, sometimes you don't see what others see in shelves or what box are they carrying, makes some funny interactions where your friend is frieking out about picking up the boxes and game won't allow it, becouse there is allready one in theyre hand, but it's invisible for the guest player not the host. Buggs are occasional, not offten and one server restart fixes them. Game is still getting updates and fixes, which is good. Plays good on Deck. Last update tho, broke the coloring option for furniture, but hopefully they will fix it soon. Recommend this game if you want something addictive.

Fun game to play with friends. Multiplayer still needs a work, sometimes doesn't sync boxes or products on shelves. Once in a while you have to restart the lobby to fix syncing issues. Also I wish you coul'd costumise your character in multiplayer or at least choose the one you like from pre made ones. I play with my girlfriend and she would love to play as female character not a man. But overall a fun coop game, still having fun and still willing to continue our shop. Also it would be cool if you could choose from licence you get which products to sell. I recommend this game, best supermarket sim on the store.
Very good game for a chill does get a bit stressful in the end tho
If you don't expect much but are open minded for what's about to come reading this title, you're up for a good and casual game.
Very nice game and relaxing especially with friends, only one thing that you have to raise prices in gameplay so it doesn't turn to restocking simulator.

With the Multiplayer update I started playing again and I love it!
Had so much fun with  my friends!

you can progress pretty quickly at the start. but after a while, it feels like you're moving boxes 90% of the time. new updates keep me playing. hoping for things like a box truck, and cooler ways to customize your store.

I have played this game for a while and enjoyed the game. Building your own store to buying more items for your store, starting out small and then making it bigger. Hiring as many staff as you need to keep your store running. Buying new products then watching how many more customers you get. I have enjoyed every aspect on this game. I would recommend this to anyone that wants to run there own store. Wants a challenge and wants to see all the aspects that the game has to offer. If your into retail and rubbing your own store then this is the game for you. Overall amazing nothing bad to say about this game so far.  I haven't tried the multiplayer version but very much enjoying the single player mode. Online orders, beating people with a bat when they try to steal from your store. Setting prices to make more money. Expanding the store so its bigger and can have more items and have a proper supermarket. The game is a chilled game if you want some time to have fun and have a game that isn't stressful this is the game for you.

LOVE this game so much. Has so much potential and far exceeds my expectations. Only thing I'll say is that I wish some of the bugs were fixed: Back stock shelves yield inaccurate quantities at times, trash bugging through shelving stands/fridge requiring you to have to move them to clean them, boxes not loading into shelving properly. Otherwise this game is beautiful. Also noticed the vehicles driving around have no people in them which is weird but doesn't effecting game play lol.

As someone who is day trading everyday, this is actually a good game teaching you how to manage your finances and slowly and steadily grow your wealth. The key lies in money management and also a firm understanding of supply and demand. Overall, great game.
this game doesn't rush you. You can play at your own pace and it still feels like good progress.

Supermarket Simulator is one of those unexpectedly addictive management games that seem simple at first, but suddenly you catch yourself playing for hours because your shelves have to be perfectly organized. You run every part of the store â€” ordering stock, setting prices, stacking items, dealing with deliveries, and even scanning products at the register. Itâ€™s oddly satisfying watching your tiny store slowly turn into a smooth, profitable business. The gameplay loop feels rewarding, the visuals match the cozy style, and even the occasional bug or chaotic physics moment just makes the experience funnier rather than frustrating. If you enjoy chill but engaging management sims where every small improvement feels meaningful, this game is absolutely worth your time.
Nice game to run in the background as you wait for all your restockers finish stocking shelves
I'm completely addicted. I cannot stop playing this game. Only get this game if you want to spend all of your free time on it lol

Have I wished I could play this instead of going to my actual job? 
Yes. 
Do I wish to actually work in a supermarket again? 
No. 
Will I continue to daydream about my supermarket while at my actual job and count down the hours till I get home to work at my unpaid supermarket job? 
Yes

10/10 only so many hours in a day and I gotta get back to ripping off my customers <3

Edit: 2 things that bother me with game-play. 
1) Boosting staff. It was annoying to start with but now having multiple staff stacking shelves this system of clicking the staff needs to change. I'm wasting so much time chasing them down individually and then picking up random boxes when I'm trying to click the staff member. Would prefer a level system on the computer for upgrading the staff members speeds ect.
2) Rubbish under shelving. Not sure if its just me but it can be hard to see rubbish hidden under shelves or in the middle of the round shelf. I've found on multiple occasions if I have to move the shelf, either it wont let me put the shelf back or customers wont see the product on the shelf and I need to save and exit to reset the shelf. This could probably be fixed by hiring a cleaner but I havent wanted to yet.

Absolutley love this game....until its stopped working properly. I play it in co-op with my partner and there has been several instances now when we have started playing and the boxes are glitched all over the place. Because the main control comes from the primary game player when the controls go (which is happening everyday now) there is no way of resolving this unless you exit the game which boots everyone and then you lose all progress you have made :(. Since the most recent update we have now found that the re-stockers just stand around looking at the wall or a box and there is nothing that will resolve this unless we exit the game. Also the amount of customers coming in has dropped considerably which means we have gone from earning 7k a day to 2k a day. This means it would takes weeks (in game weeks) to earn enough to expand the shop or storage :(. we have tried 3 times now to play again but its the same each time
Glitching boxes 
re stockers stuck and staring at walls
Primary player controls stop working
lack of customers
boxes despawn from shelves and re spawn well anywhere

Its making the game unplayable in co op :(
as someone who loves simulator games to relax, i recommend. I am also a business major going for accounting so I like to have fun and take my business seriously, ya know. haha it's a very fun game

I spent my entire 8-hour shift at my real job stocking shelves, and now I'm home, paying for the privilege of doing my job again in Supermarket Simulator. This isn't a game, it's a personality test to see if I have Stockholm syndrome.
Amazing game! Love all the updates and fun things you can add to your storefront.

Easy to understand and play.
Fun to play and pass time with it, and since there's no end to it you can just keep playing until you grow tired of it, but they keep updating stuff so it's still fun and engaging.
bruh this is fun fr it reminds me of being at work lmao i clock in at my real job then clock out then clock in on da game

This has lowkey become my favorite game. Its super fun. Scratches a certain itch unlike any other game. It has surprising amount of depth to it too. I think its hilarious that you can beat up shoplifters with a baseball bat. I would love to see updates for this game that increase the things you can sell and more customization items. Highly recommend
Good game, frequent updates. Great for those that enjoy simulation games.
Fun game to pass the time if you like grindy, level up based style games. One down side so far is there's no option to change the controls or bindings.
i've been playing since the early access, it was fun then and even better now. Just a nice chill (and sometimes stressful) game to mindlessly play.
Addicting. This game has me clocking out of my real life job and coming home only to clock into my virtual job.

This game has really made me appreciate why cashiers hate dealing with coin change. 
Next time a cashier gives me grumpy looks I will apologize and tell him I understand!
great game, money is a problem. also the mobile orders? no idea how to use it, get someone else to do it.
Loving it so far, recent updates have made it interesting cant wait to play the new content
Decent game, just simple relaxing and rewarding. However, there are still some obvious bugs and glitches that can be fixed to further boost the overall experience.
Gets my heart pumping like I'm really working, I agree with other people that its basically a stocking simulator but that is my favorite part :D
very fun. i'd recommend using mods to keep it fresh. but very enjoyable still
Its good although im not a huge fan of the delivery system for getting online orders to the customers. bit of a slow grind but it is very relaxing and satisfying.
Great game. Was fun when it came out, and now there is even more things to do in it!

this gae are overall better but more changes requared in store graphics or items all over are good buy and enjoy the game.ðŸ‘ŒðŸ˜Š
One of the most interactive simulator games I have played in a while. Reminds me of the good old days as a cashier, working at my local supermarket.
Just a great fun game to play with friends, many laughs and shenanigans and its never a dull moment. Would recommend to anyone looking for a chill time.

Great game honestly, I play it when I just want to enjoy myself and do some reorganisation, and I love that it keeps getting new things added to it. It's become so much much more than I could have expected at the beginning and I love seeing it grow. :)

A really great way to kick back and relax you can spend hours just tinkering with all the details of your shop.
I think its a god way to switch off and just chill while playing.
Really like this game, I'm on the second round playing it and enjoy it more this time then the first. Also mostly because of all the new updates this year.
9/10, can't push people into the street but otherwise good game.

The game is really fun, sometimes fast-paced, and well balanced. Honestly I just got started with it and my real-life retail experience made it seem easier. However, it was still challenging and it was really fun making money and building up the store. The game adds complexity bit by bit so that you aren't overwhelmed right away, and you can buy licenses for new products when you feel ready. The game creators did a very good job making the game fun and balanced.

This is by far the most stressful game I've played in a long while
I loved every second of it

I never would have thoughtr that this kind of simulator would take my interest like this!
I do find that my fps starts at about 230-240 and over time, maybe an hour it will be 18-20fps.

My scanner sings a steady beep,
a rhythm customers rarely keep.
But when the line moves nice and quick,
I feel my heartbeat match each click.
A tiny world of grocery blissâ€”
who knew a job could feel like this?
While a little rough around the edges, this game is surprisingly fun!
I can't lie, this game is silly and stupid and I play it way too much because its very addicting. Like I get home and cannot wait to play this game and watch Netflix. I have ADHD. It's great.
A fun and relaxing game that you will definitely lose track of time playing.

You would think after long days doing my actual job I wouldn't want to load up a game where I am simulating another job, but this game is deceivingly addicting. LOL. It's especially fun to play with friends and have a person who handles each aspect of the daily operations. 

Some current bugs that exist in both single player and multiplayer that can get a little annoying, but don't necessarily make me not want to play: 
1. Sometimes the shelf count in the storage rooms aren't right or show a quantity when there is no box there. 
2. Shelves glitch through walls sometimes when they are moved.
3. On multiplayer specifically, if you've been playing for several hours, the player characters might start glitching into the furniture or crashing.
The only solve I've found for the above bugs is to simply save and exit out of the game and then reload.

A few criticisms or things I'd like to see in the future:
1. Character customization/choice 
2. Fixes on multiplayer as it gets pretty buggy
3. Better growth/progression - even with loans, it can be difficult to save for bigger expenses as you expand storage and the store even more. Everything only gets more expensive and upkeep of stock in the store can make it feel like a never ending cycle of never getting somewhere at times. 
4. Ability to hire a worker to handle delivering the online orders

A note:
1. The shelving/fridges have the ability to come in a variety of colors, but the drop down selection has never worked for me so I am unable to take advantage of that customization. Not sure if this is a widespread bug or something specific to my experience.
I worked retail and this hit's to close to that trauma xD still a great game tho
Tbh i never thought  i would put so many hours in this game. Its a real chill game to just play when you dont want to think about anything else or put much effort into it
This game is very chill and great with others, especially when me and my girlfriend have our own store called "Dis and Deez" lmao

i see this game when im at supermarkets now. thank you. 
me like charging 60 cents extra on all items. 
i love being an owner of my super market.
Very fun and addicting game to pass time with.

WOW me and my wife played this a while back and Ä± was addicted to it but then Ä± made the mistake of playing it alone once and my wife got mad at me cuz she said that this was our game and then she divorced me and we got back together to play supermarket simxagain we love eachother so much and we also love supermarket included

dont text me stay away from me Ä± have wife fuck u bitch alsocincluded
Its Fine but I think that it could be better, its glichy and Im in dept -1600

I have played Many supermarket type simulators, this one - by far the best! 
the visuals are nice on the eyes, the progression in unlocking parts of the shop or getting new product takes the right amount of time and planning. You can choose to be lazy and buy product from the scanner or source it yourself for much cheaper helping earn more moneys quicker. Its easy to manage the whole shop yourself if you want or hire workers. It's just such a fun relaxing game!! 10/10
The gameplay loop can get a bit repetitive, but it's a nice game to play and relax.  The fact that the devs are still updating this is awesome.  I would recommend this game!

I've been playing this game before the full release and its one of my favorite chill games ever, I love the mechanics and the variety of products you can get if you're looking for a chill game it's so worth getting this one.
Its pretty fun to play when bored, and they are updating the game frequently. Would def recommend to someone who likes simulator games.

Game is good, thank god the dev added multiplayer. I don't think it's worth it though now compared to Supermarket Simulator for the price, but there is a lot more depth for the money you pay for this game. 8/10

Don't get me wrong I love this game because of the possibility and how you can make your store however you would like but I only have one complaint, last night I spent 4 hours creating my supermarket and I can back this morning and everything is one gone. Yes I did press the save button multiply times through out my play time and once I got off I save my game but still nothing saved and my progress reset. This makes me very upset that my progress is gone but other than that this is a amazing game.
Very fun game. Better with friends. Still hase some bugs in multiplayer.

This  game is so darn addictive and I have no idea why I cannot stop playing. I tell myself I'm only going to play 1 more in game day but I end up playing the game for way longer than planned. Only thing so far that wasn't obvious was operation of the produce scale, I had to youtube that one lol,

The gameplay is genuinely fascinating and surprisingly addictive. Thereâ€™s a huge variety of products to trade, which keeps the game engaging and makes every session feel different. The developers have consistently released updates that enhance the gameplay and polish the mechanics even further. Overall, a great experience for anyone who loves market-based games.

One thing Iâ€™d really like to see in the future is an expanded product list and additional floors featuring home appliances, sports items, and other categories youâ€™d normally find in a mall. Additions like these could take the game to an entirely new level.

Great game to wind down and relax - although running a big store is quire the opposite!

Overall recommended as progression is good and you can definitely feel a sense of accomplishment when you get to improve the store and make it worth visiting.
If you've ever worked a retail job and wanted to kill yourself every time you had to go to work, you will love this game for some reason
Fun game to play and don't really need to think much about what needs to be done
Very fun and satisfying. I love all the new updates and it makes it even better. The new employees look funny though lol but its great. Very customizable and relaxing game.

this game is pretty fun if you want to sit around losing time being a manager, honestly I can play this game for hours and not get bored. My fiance can't understand why I love simulator games but it's so addicting.

its really fun and i like how customizable it is. if you are on mac some of the controls arent possible such as rotating furniture which is a bit annoying. also wish the mouse sensitivity was higher. besides that i recommend it.

I really like this game and I still recommend it despite multiplayer giving me a hard time, especially because I have another person playing on the same network. We desync from the host a lot, and when the host reloads there's garbage everywhere and the store is in shambles.

This game is honestly one of the most addictive games I've played. I've played for 100 hours or so and I still can't get enough. I'm barely 70% done with the game. This game needs cross play between Xbox and steam IMMEDIATELY! This game is perfect for you if you just want to kick back and relax. And for a great price too!

Overall a fun game. There are a few quirks to get used to. My only complaint, which isn't the game itself, is that the des are apparently really against modding. The mods are what really draw me to the game. Real world items and such. But the devs are breaking the mods and making it harder to mod with each update. Again, not a "game issue" but mods really lengthen the longevity of games. IMHO
It's very satifying to manage your own supermarket. Some issues not withstanding, the game is enjoyable to play solo or with friends.
Pretty good game to play, works pretty well with proton too
Running around like a maniac trying to have everything sufficiently in stock, on the shelves and at the same time cash everyone out is suprisingly fun.

This is a cool game. Despite the fact that I get a headache every time I play it, it's still fun to see your supermarket grow bigger and bigger. I haven't seen the thieves yet, but I think it'll make my head hurt too much, so I'm not playing this anymore
Very Cool game, love the frequent updates.

Stock and Shop till you drop! 

Amazingly chill simulator
Perfect for sitting back serving the neighborhood and always having sweet deals for everyone!

You cant go wrong with this one
Simple game but surprisingly fun and addictive

Both entertaining and fun. I have turned off the shoplifters due to just wanting to play and have good time, not trying to actually run a shop. The best thing about the game is that you can choose your own pace.
Love playing this with my friend. Could improve the character customization to look better when play with friends.
Good game to play with Friends, and the game is very fun
I truly love this game and with every update they add more stuff and it gets better and better
Fun game, i also suggest playing supermarket together so you can own your own store with your buddies!!

Literally a game I came home to, and launched after a long day at work. There is just something about packing shelves and taking peoples money that I still to this day, find so lethargic. Plus the fact that they still update and support the game is epic - catch thief pocketing a bag of coffee... and bonk! Yes please.

I always wanted to be a supermarket mogul. Now I can be.

I also always wanted to have my stock float in mid air, have shelves stick to my hands, have my staff stand facing walls doing nothing and have alternate realities of each person looking at things, so it is especially good that I can get all those matrix glitches through Supermarket Simulator too!

So yeah, its is buggy as hell (mostly in multiplayer mode) and still has lots of stuff which could be developed on, but it's a bit of fun if you want a bit of casual play or a laugh with some friends.
Great game. They keep adding more stuff making it more fun. Never gets old.

negative.review:
Listen, I do love this game, but holy shit it's not hard to make this game accessible. Why, in 2025, do we still have games that force you to hold the shift key to sprint otherwise you move at the speed of a snail. Holding keys, especially the stupid shift key, is extremely painful. Give me a goddamned toggle option or allow me to remap these ridiculous bindings. 

Then I saw that the game allegedly had "full controller support" which is wild that they'd somehow get that implemented before a TOGGLE FOR SPRINTING, but it is also a total lie. It's lagging when I'm trying to use the controller and the button labeled "A" to drop the box when it's a green highlight just puts it back in my hand rather than set it down, so I'm only able to either throw it or hold onto the box for all eternity. 

I just want to be able to play my mindless little game without being irritated that my little dude skipped leg day for all eternity or being in agony because my hypermobile fingers + arthritis despise holding shift. Seriously, how hard is it to have a toggle button? Or, you know, speed slider options in the menu. 

At least they finally gave us save slots. There's still a lot that should have been added before this game left early access. Early access started in February 2024 and here we are in November 2025 and the devs couldn't even give us a toggle for sprint. Fuck man. I just want to play the damn game.
I like the game but the use of AI art hurts me emotionally, I bought it before they went all in on that. Don't buy it if you dont want more ai art everywhere.

This game is exhausting and I do not understand how this game has so many good reviews. It takes an absolute astronomical amount of time for this to be a profitable game and you might as well go actually run a grocery store. I don't think the devs spend a single dollar of the money they get off of this game to make it better. This whole game is AI slop and I genuinely cannot express to y'all how much I want my money back. I tried. I tried with this game so hard because the concept is good and the co-op was exciting but I don't think I've gone to bed thinking "wow I really enjoyed that gaming session" a single time I have played this game and I will never be able to look at toilet paper the same. I never want to buy or store it again a day in my life. Don't even spend your money on this game if it's on sale, I'm sure the money is going into some sort of tech start up for data collecting anyway. An actual 0/10.

The last update broke 95% of the mods for this game. Why is that important? Because the game economy and progression is horrendous without mods. Thereâ€™s little to no content, you just have to grind hundreds of days in order to get all the space upgrades and the profit/day stays the same no matter how many new products you sell. 

The early game is fun but the mid game is stupid, stale and grindy for no reason whatsoever.

They need to either fix the economy or fix whatever the mods were dependent on.

$20 for buggy game. Just a few example:

-Look directly at sun and it will disappear.
-If an item runs out on a shelf, restocking it will reset the price. This is just inconsistent too. Sometimes it will and sometimes it wont.
- Stockers will bug out and take ages or just not restock at all.

I can go on and on. for $20 this is just unacceptable. This is mobile game AD quality. Hoping steam will refund me past the 2hrs it took to realize how bad this game was.
bugs galore, multplayer is barely functioning, last patch (a month ago) added a progression slowing bug in multplayer that has been known since it was released with no patch to address it

Game uses AI generated images without disclosing it.  I hate AI slop.  

The game also isn't fun to play.
Too many bugs in this game, poor design choices and missing features that would be in Day One as standard in other games in this genre.
This game is super buggy. Would also be better if we could customize our characters. tnx.

Buggy as â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥. Playing with friends makes it way better but all other times I mourn the loss of my newly bought shelf as soon as I set it aside it disappears into the â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ abyss.
I do recommend the game but with every new patch it is buggier than ever. I cannot choose a color for my furniture anymore.

i would get this game while its on sale, i got this game for 12 dollars and i first regretted it because its the type of game you play for a few hours ad the get bored like a  week minecraft phase but its for like 3 hours. i have kept my save everytime i come back though so im always making progression and not replaying the very beginning of the game but in the end this game really just feels like your working another job

1.1 is the first version I played
but this so-called 1.1 is so unpolished, just like an early access game.
lack of instructions, minor bugs, and some control glitches...
it feels like many places can be better if devs put some time into each of them

and a worse thing is that the game runs a 30% discount right after 2 days I purchased it.... 

I really like this kind of business simulation game. Luckily, I'm so late to buy this game, but unfortunately, it seems I'm too early to buy this too

60 hours played and they've just released a patch which only added new content, no bug fixes--there are a lot of bugs. This patch also introduced new issues, including one that has discouraged us from wanting to continue playing: multicolor shelving options are available allowing you to customize your store's appearance, however the newest patch just broke the ability to order shelves with colors, which means if we continue playing we'll have to at some point come back and replace all of our new shelves and restock -- or more likely we just quit altogether. Developer *needs* to prioritize a consistent, bug-free gaming experience as these often break the "Simulation" immersion.

Don't let the developers fool you that this is a fully released, 1.0 version game, as it most defenetly feels like an early release version! Don't get me wrong, I did enjoy the main game mechanics of owning and constantly upgrading my own supermarket, alongside some of my friends, but the game feels more like an asset flip with some serious issues, rather than a fully working and original co-op game. 

Restockers don't work properly, prices and stock values are not well synced between co-op players, as well as achievments. Saddest thing is, not even the main door position synced properly if the person who purchases it is not the server host, thus leading to some major issues, such as some players having to exit the building through walls.

In conclusion, wait for more fixes and patches before purchasing it, as the price is not that low either!

Pretty big Bug: We had 2 storage shelves, a cleaner, security guard, starage clerk, cashier, carmeras... We were in business! But suddenly when stocking up, the Packages started disappearing within the shelves, while the shelves still registered the packages. the shelves were full but neither player nor AI could interact with the goods in storage. Green and read boxes started appearing on the ground near the loading area, like ghosts of christmas past. The game was made unplayable at this point and we had to abort our business, which we had spent real days developing.

FIX THIS!

I would love to recommend it, but the progression is so slow, you progress through levels very slow (experience earning) and even when you get to the level you need, you might not have enough money to buy all the products and expansions.

Also being forced to deliver what other people want to buy sucks, I wish I could turn it off until I feel like I have everything under control and can afford to run around the city and deliver it, the same way you can do with thieves.
Fun game until the endless looping bird noises that you cant turn off drive you insane, how hard is it to put ambient noise sliders in your video game
would of been way better game with workshop support. otherwise its same old boring rinse and repeat.

Supermarket Simulator, I find to be a very relaxing and satisfying game. Seeing my business flourish and experience significant growth gives me a huge boost of dopamine haha.

I can see why some people never pick this game up again after a run, since it can get old and repetitive, but I'm loving it. However, there are two things that I want to nitpick about. 

1. Progression after unlocking expansions. I'm currently at store level 52 and I'm finding it slow and difficult to find a proper way to gain more profit. 

2. I rarely encounter bugs in games, this one, I experience at least two in every session I do. 

Janitors work 20% of the time. They freeze after cleaning dirt/picking up trash and stay frozen for your entire session. Dirt getting stuck beyond the playable area of the store. NPCs of online orders don't spawn on the map. It's frustrating after putting an order together, going to the location marked on the map and they're not there. Stockers constantly freeze mid-stocking. The only fix I found was to fire and then rehire. I don't want to be doing that every time it happens.

This game is riddled with bugs that make the experience difficult to enjoy. At this point, I can't recommend this game to new players, for now at least.
Decent game but I can't play it much at a time before the lack of accessibility features. I'd kill for a sprint toggle as holding shift is incredibly painful for me
It is fun for a few hours, but gets repetitive after hiring the first few workers. This game has a lot of potential but it I see no ambition of the dev to implement that stuff.

I actually love the game, especially with friends, but some prices are unchangeable now and/or randomly change to 0 despite repeated attempts to set it to something else.

Bad review goes away once this gets fixed.
Doesn't offer much. Go play the multiplayer free version, or better yet, go play the TCG card shop one.
Use of AI in their art is an immediate no-no from me. When I bought the game there wasn't AI-generated content, and if I could refund the game I would. Pay artists.

The November patch was an awesome addition to the game but they neglected the restocking mechanic AGAIN. Your going to spend more time and money boosting employees than playing the game with all the new things like Deliveries. 600+ hours into this game, as good as it is constantly having to constantly keep trying to click employees to make them faster is just to annoying when you want to look after customers and ordering and price checking.

Either make restockers work twice as fast or slider to make them permanently faster ( for a price OFC) or even add another 6 restocker employees.  We shouldnt have to "mod" an original game.

Cherry

Yeah. As much as I enjoyed the early game of this. I certainly reached the point of boredom. And the point of no return.
This slowed down to a point where even cheating felt just pointless.
I have nothing else to say about it.
Good start, bad end.

Fun concept.
But the choice of font style and colors makes it unplayable for me.
Bold font with low contrast and small size gives me a headache.

I cannot recommend this game. 97% of my playtime is game running on the background as I have habit to complete achievements. This game sucks both as active and idle game. Fun maybe for first 5 hours and doesnÂ´t deserve more than 5 dollars price tag.

Negatives:
- progression is tied to "experience", not money. Which is complete opposite of what capitalist simulator should be. About 90% of the game I had abundance of money and just waiting for days to pass by to accumulate enough customers to get experience for expansion. I was running every product with 50-70% discount to get as much customers as possible. Yet it still took forever because how badly are gaming mechanics optimized (experience per customer is capped at 4-5xp, nothing player can do to improve it)

- Game punishes player for variety of goods and roleplay. From 20 available product licenses it makes sense to buy about 5 of them. Rest is going to decrease profit and not increase number of customers. Name Cleaning supplies and bookshop simulator would be more fitting.

- Limits on number of employees. I can have 6 restockers with stupid conditions to unlock hiring them like owning number of storage racks I donÂ´t even use, because goods just sell so fast it goes right into shelves. My operation would require like 20 restockers.

- Lot of bugs and laggy when switching from idle to active game.

- No ability to speed up the days or simulate them. No respect for playerÂ´s time. Modders fixed this until devs broke the mods. No workshop support.

- Lacks basic statistics like detailed expenses and information about number of sold product. No option for regular deliveries. Really no depth and quality of life from developers.

- Customers never leave. You can run supermarket with 150 customers per day with single self checkout and they would just wait in line. Yet you can hire 12 people as cashiers, twice the limit of restockers that are actually useful and essential. Not a single thought was put into this game mechanics.

All around bad and overrated game.
Mutliplayer has mayor issues. inventory not syncing is the worst one. even the restockers seem to not sync  with what is or is not there

I really want to like this game, but it has so many weird problems, wich make it unplayable after some time.

- It is incredibly unbalanced and unoptimized in many diffirent ways. Dont know where to begin with this. 
One of them are hard caps on Staff for example. You can hire only so many ppl, who work so damn slow that you have to let your game run in the background for like 30 minutes every ingame day so they catch up with theirs work. The ONLY way to quicken your staff is by running after them shoving 3 Dollars up their ass, for them to run a bit quicker for a couple seconds. wtf

On the other Hand you only need Staffmember overseeing 8 Selfcheckouts, instead of paying 8 cashiers. Horribly balanced...

- There are fundamental quality of life things missing.

- The delivery system is a joke

- Unoptimized: It gets very laggy 

- There is nothing really to do latergame. This is a weird critic but i would have loved for some events to unfold. 
Maybe sponsor a race or something. 
Or i have to pull certain goods from my store because the health organisation deemed it unsave. 
Maybe leveling your staff so they earn more money and work more efficient.
The ability to expand to have multible stores?
Id love to focus on one group of products.
Have competition or rivals...


This game could have been so much more

The prices of my products keep resetting randomly, which makes me lose money if I don`t check the tags everyday and sometimes i can`t even change the prices because i can only delete numbers, not add any. That makes the game kinda frustratingly unplayable.

Fun game in co-op. But there are way too many bugs causing restarts many of the times and you have to be careful when you save so that you don't lose anything.

Please fix your bugs, there are way too many.

Playing this on solo may work well, but solo wasn't the reason I purchased the game.

This game is a chore.

The beginning of the game is quite satisfying, but there is a moment where you cannot progress without PAINFUL grind. The game starts to feel like a second job. Tha gameplay loop is nice for few hours, but then it gets frustrating. You cannot make auto-orders, amount of money you earn down the road is small, and your workers cost very much. While the workers help with storage and unpacking you easily get lost if you don't learn where is what by heart (you get to the point where you have to remember about ordering and changing prices of 10s of products EVERY DAY). It's more of a sad simulation of being an owner of business than fun game.
Hoping the devs fix the price reset problem. make the game tedious and annoying.

No difference from when it was early access to full release. Controls are clunky, and there's no way to set keybinds in the game or even quality of life settings like a UI size adjuster. Anything you store in your crate won't be there the next time you load in, despite saving the game (bye 2 full boxs' worth of product). Not even a flashlight option even though the entire outside is super dark and hard to see at night (should I be canceling online orders at night??). 
Honestly so much could change with just simple quality of life changes, like having a number indicator when holding a box so you don't accidentally throw away product. I was so excited for the full release, but this is what we get. Just a very barebones game all in all. 
I think it's clear this was just dropped in favor of their other game.

Game is very fun but it was not ready for full release.
Bugs are so bad with invisible boxes and the game crashes constantly to start menu.
We have had to redo entire days worth of work because of the crashes in multiplayer.

When these bugs are resolved I will change my review to positive.

This is a good game and all, I think it's worth buying it when it is on sale and you might need a good pc/laptop to play this game smoothly. Sadly my laptop couldn't handle it, but the others might enjoy this game otherwise. The game needs a little optimization for the performance, if it's possible.
Quite boring to play, prefer to have a lot of more detailed simulation in this game.

This game sucks so bad. The game takes well over 500 hours of your life to even profit. This game is so bad cashoh had to make a part 40 because it takes so long to even be able to be fun. mind you cashos videos are 2 hours each. I cant even have a good shift on this game because a pack of eggs are 50 dollars each, how can you make money even the dumb clients think 2 dollars is to much? this game is not good dont buy it unless you are a low life that has extra time that they would like to waste. if i could get my money back i so would, the water park one is sooooooooo much better, they deserve the money so much more than whoever invented this dumb game. thank you for reading this, DO NOT BUY THIS GAME!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Game is pretty buggy right now, once some of the bugs get fixed this will go positive
This game crashes every 5 mins when you play co-op. Very very annoying.
Buggy disaster that takes too long to make progress after a certain point leading to burnout.
It gets laggy whenever i ride a vehicle. Please fix this issue

Buggy, uninspired and questionable QOL and Game Design. Not worth the full price.

Multiplayer is still buggy, server crashes sometimes and desync happens all the time. Single player is playable.

The game art design is uninspired and basic, gameplay is decent but has several questionable QOL choice which makes gameplay painful at times.

Despite the developer using basic assets, coding and game design is lackluster which, at the rate of how the game updates, will take a few years at best to iron things out.

Game is really fun early game. Once you hit level 50, the game reflects the devs pitfalls. The scaling is atrocious. Profits remain slim while costs to grow become impossible grinds. Additionally, even after having every restocker they are too slow once you obtain a significant amount of product. Restocking can take way too long adding more grind. Prices need to be reduced to scale smoother. This is a casual game it should scale like one.
to much bug, even my save file suddenly gone, framedrop everytime
buggy ai, useless restockers
When start to open storage is so lag
enjoyable but the use of AI is disgusting.
make the fucking lights brighter pls <3
Fun for the first few hours
I PLAY ALL GAMES SAVE YOUR CASH GAMERS
it gets rlly. overstimulating

very repetitive. not gud
Way too many glitches.

I don't appreciate the use of AI.

I like the game quite a bit, but I lose hours of saved progress every update.  

The game needs several quality of life changes to be genuinely playable:
- bigger text options/high contrast mode for easier reading. So much in-game text is really difficult to read.
- control remapping
- better item filtering/search bar on market/pricing screens
- vehicle disappearing bugfix
Game release killed the best mods. Also they change the cover art into AI slop. Huge L.

This game is frustrating. While it's mildly fun at first, it rapidly devolves into a 'Restocking Simulator.' 90% of your time is spent waiting for your painfully slow staff to refill shelves.
If this were an idle game like Cookie Clicker, that would be fine. But it presents itself as an active economy and management game, which is a complete misrepresentation. Your primary 'active involvement' is just watching and waiting.

I cannot recommend it. It simply isn't the game it claims to be.

The Devs at Nokta Games have removed the disclosure that this game is using generative AI  for it's assets and it goes against Steam's term of service for AI usage and breaks it's current T.O.S.

I will change this review if the generative AI content in the game was removed recently and replaced with actual art or if there is "currently" generative AI content that persists in Supermarket Simulator Nokta Games has to legally re-add the disclosure that this game is currently using generative AI content, and that's only if generative AI content still persists in the game currently.

Positive reviews are quite missleading. Proper name for the game should be: "Restocker Simulator". 
As much as the game seems fun at first, it becomes tedious and boring very fast unless you are playing co-op with friends for the following reason:

- Real job as cashier is lot more interesting with funny, frustrating or akward encounters with customers then in this game where customers are robotic and boring. Only shoplifters bring a bit of fun. If the real job is more fun then the game it tells alot
- Town is bare bones. You have few shops around but most of the town is just missed pontential
- Delivery is tedious and you can't hire anyone to do the job for you. So avoiding deliveres is the best option
- Most of the time what you do in this game 90% of the time is ordering and restocking because staff can be slow, becomes boring after a while
- There is no staff satisfaction they are just robots standing and slaving away
- There is nothing interesting to unlock or see other then expanding what you already have, very bare bones in content

Take a game called "Supermarket Together" for a example. A game that is free and offers by far a lot more content, a lot more interesting things to do, taking care of your staff happines, taking care of your customers comfort, hiring a large team, having mutliple tasks to do, hiring your own delivery, unlocking a large skill tree with abilities, running a bigger store, ect. And this game is free ofers lot more content and fun then a Supermarket Simulator that costs 20$. And yes it can be played in multiplayer as well up to 16 players.

Listen, I do love this game, but holy shit it's not hard to make this game accessible. Why, in 2025, do we still have games that force you to hold the shift key to sprint otherwise you move at the speed of a snail. Holding keys, especially the stupid shift key, is extremely painful. Give me a goddamned toggle option or allow me to remap these ridiculous bindings. 

Then I saw that the game allegedly had "full controller support" which is wild that they'd somehow get that implemented before a TOGGLE FOR SPRINTING, but it is also a total lie. It's lagging when I'm trying to use the controller and the button labeled "A" to drop the box when it's a green highlight just puts it back in my hand rather than set it down, so I'm only able to either throw it or hold onto the box for all eternity. 

I just want to be able to play my mindless little game without being irritated that my little dude skipped leg day for all eternity or being in agony because my hypermobile fingers + arthritis despise holding shift. Seriously, how hard is it to have a toggle button? Or, you know, speed slider options in the menu. 

At least they finally gave us save slots. There's still a lot that should have been added before this game left early access. Early access started in February 2024 and here we are in November 2025 and the devs couldn't even give us a toggle for sprint. Fuck man. I just want to play the damn game.
I like the game but the use of AI art hurts me emotionally, I bought it before they went all in on that. Don't buy it if you dont want more ai art everywhere.

It was fun when I was still trying things out. But the more I play, the more constricting the game feels. The daily overview is so barebones that I spent most of the time checking the inventory to see what sells and what doesn't. In addition, players are penalized for making specialized choices. We need to sell EVERY PRODUCT available or risk losing Store Points.

Players are expected to spend money on security to fend off thieves. We can't catch them, nor get any monetary rewards from beating them. So the best thing to do is open menu and remove thieves from your game entirely, which is hilarious. Supermarket Simulator also shoves 'online orders' right into your face without warning. Unfortunately, there is no option to turn it off this time.

Game was great till the multiplayer update was released. once this got downloaded, my save game lost 2 days of gameplay and went to a point that was a few days behind in game time. now, i can't move the shelves around

I did enjoy this for a while but I'm choosing a thumbs down because the developers decided to just fill the game with grinding busy work. Had they at least included a way to auto order items I may have given it a positive, but having to manually order everything every day kills the fun for me. Still, I guess it's the best in it's genre, so some might enjoy it.
although it's fun I'm almost sure this is vibe coded and it's ridiculously overpriced for what it offers
Just loaded the game up after the multiplayer update to find that at level 63 all of my shelves and self scan checkouts have disappeared I don't have the cash to replace them.

This game is exhausting and I do not understand how this game has so many good reviews. It takes an absolute astronomical amount of time for this to be a profitable game and you might as well go actually run a grocery store. I don't think the devs spend a single dollar of the money they get off of this game to make it better. This whole game is AI slop and I genuinely cannot express to y'all how much I want my money back. I tried. I tried with this game so hard because the concept is good and the co-op was exciting but I don't think I've gone to bed thinking "wow I really enjoyed that gaming session" a single time I have played this game and I will never be able to look at toilet paper the same. I never want to buy or store it again a day in my life. Don't even spend your money on this game if it's on sale, I'm sure the money is going into some sort of tech start up for data collecting anyway. An actual 0/10.

The last update broke 95% of the mods for this game. Why is that important? Because the game economy and progression is horrendous without mods. Thereâ€™s little to no content, you just have to grind hundreds of days in order to get all the space upgrades and the profit/day stays the same no matter how many new products you sell. 

The early game is fun but the mid game is stupid, stale and grindy for no reason whatsoever.

They need to either fix the economy or fix whatever the mods were dependent on.

A good game, but lacks someone to do the deliveries, which are a pain. I personally don't enjoy leaving my store. 

Also, I changed my review due to the amount of basic bugs. It feels unfinished. 4.5/10.

This is a very basic game loop. Buy it if it drops below $5. Late game is so laggy it is unplayable. Also there is no point in getting to late game. After you hire a couple cashiers and stockers the game is over. There is no benefit to playing to the late game. Just different skinned boxes of food items for more money. Nothing changes, nothing scales. Hour 1 of the game is the same as hour 20.

$20 for buggy game. Just a few example:

-Look directly at sun and it will disappear.
-If an item runs out on a shelf, restocking it will reset the price. This is just inconsistent too. Sometimes it will and sometimes it wont.
- Stockers will bug out and take ages or just not restock at all.

I can go on and on. for $20 this is just unacceptable. This is mobile game AD quality. Hoping steam will refund me past the 2hrs it took to realize how bad this game was.

Was fun when i was a small market offering limited products but when i moved up it literally became impossible for me to progress unless i took out a loan to get upgrades, maybe its realistic or i am a shity business owner but i price gouge still cant meet the insane demand of my customers and restocking my products literally drains all my money.

I really liked this game, but the save function doesn't work properly - I loaded my game this morning to find I had basically lost all of yesterday's progress. This coincided with a multiplayer option suddenly appearing in the menu so perhaps it's related to that. BUT I LOST HOURS OF GAMEPLAY. If you can't even save progress WHAT IS THE POINT. Super super disappointed.
bugs galore, multplayer is barely functioning, last patch (a month ago) added a progression slowing bug in multplayer that has been known since it was released with no patch to address it

This has a lot of potential as the pioneer of its genre but...
The coop update made the game a bugfest.
Time freezing for the host resulting in endless days
Interaction bugs for the people joining
The worst is that it seems the more you grow your business, the more frequently bug appears.
Not quite fun to recreate the server and reconnect every 30m.

Game uses AI generated images without disclosing it.  I hate AI slop.  

The game also isn't fun to play.

New players won't encounter this right away, but as you close into the late game and you expand your warehouse you will notice that after a certain threshold boxes of items disappear from you inventory. Thousands of boxes are needed to trigger this bug, but it is so frustrating that I don't plan to keep playing anymore and if I had known this was a problem going in I would have never bought the game.

Initially quite fun and addicting, but turned out to be disappointingly buggy. I lost an entire evening of game play--several game days and tens of thousands of dollars--after none of my saves from the day ended up persisting.
Too many bugs in this game, poor design choices and missing features that would be in Day One as standard in other games in this genre.
This game is super buggy. Would also be better if we could customize our characters. tnx.

Buggy as â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥. Playing with friends makes it way better but all other times I mourn the loss of my newly bought shelf as soon as I set it aside it disappears into the â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ abyss.
I do recommend the game but with every new patch it is buggier than ever. I cannot choose a color for my furniture anymore.
Really buggy. At times will have a whole line of customers and the game bugs out and when you reload, especially after 9P, you lose all that revenue as you cant take any more customers.

Online order is bugged. Mulitiplayer is super buggy.
not really enjoyable anymore

because of the colour contrast of the register i cannot play this game more then 30 minutes without getting a headache ill circle back once you can change the lights on the register but rn i cannot play this game at all

This game is super fun and has a lot of potential but it still feels like it is in Early Access: some NPCs missing textures, bugs that prevent you from moving/interacting, bugs that cut of sound randomly. I haven't seen any update from the developers since the June release and they don't seem to be proactive about looking at bug reports in the discord. If you want to purchase, buy at a discount with the expectation that this may be the final state of the game.

While this game is a ton of fun, it makes it so hard to get into when my comupter gets so insanely hot while playing it. Ive tried everything even turning down resolution and fps, but it still makes it feel like my mac is gonna explode even after just 3 minutes of gameplay. So if you have a mac, while fun, i dont entirely recomend this one.

fun game but i had to download mods to make it enjoyable again
then i recently learned that the co-op update broke my mods, so i won't be touching the game till that's fixed. decent game but goes really slow.

The novelty behind the game was fun for a while, and this was arguably *the* game that launched the whole "simulator" genre as we know it now.

The problem is the progression is MIND-NUMBINGLY SLOW. There's no new fun gimmicks or tools to be had as you level up because the gameplay loop is:

*Load day
*Order or buy product
*Wait 30+ minutes as your workers stock the store
*Open store
*Make $20 in profit

And the profit margins are razor thin, and the upgrades are exceedingly expensive. There's ways to trick the game into generating an appropriate amount of profit but honestly, Its just boring. The finish line is there but this game is more idler than simulator. I'd almost rather work in an actual grocery store.

So far my opinion on the game as a whole for $25 Canadian is it's okay, I'm having fun with everything supermarket, the problems come when anything not in the initial scope of the game is brought up.

Problems I have with the game

- Online Deliveries: At some point you just start getting online deliveries, you don't get to enable/disable them or even set a price or appoint an employee to do it for you. You're simply stuck doing them or letting the order fail.
Oh you also only have 1 inventory slot so you have to deliver 1 thing at a time and return to the shop every single time unless you buy a vehicle which gives +1 inventory per tier of vehicle.

- Mobility: You run fairly fast for someone in a small supermarket, but when you have to go across town to deliver a paper bag with a few things in it you're incredibly slow. You do get access to "Vehicles" but it's really just the worst driving possible.
To elaborate, you're stuck in first person with a messed up FOV that you either get to see price tags or have wider vision, you can turn your head while driving but there's no return so you can't get back to center to know where you're going unless you exit the vehicle and re-enter it.
The vehicles all make you feel like a geriatric, your acceleration is that of a 8 year old on their first bicycle and your top speed is an RC-Car.

The skateboard's kinda fun, but it's really lacking since you aren't much faster than on foot and you're stuck with tank controls, you also don't get extra "storage" with the skateboard so if you want storage you have to upgrade to one of the real vehicles but they're just not worth it. (They drive terribly, the city is a hellscape for navigating, you have to pay for gas and there's only 1 gas station)

I love the game but the glitches are atrocious. especially in multiplayer. load our multiplayer game, trash everywhere even in not expanded areas where we cant reach and we lose xp due to hygeine complaints. workers sometimes do nothing and just sit there, players will glitch alot from not being able to do anything(even pausing the game" or boxes glitching in my hand or on the floor where i encounter infinit boxes yet they aren't actually registered, our ping is at 20 so definetly not internet issue. please fix those glitches its making me not want to play

There are definitely good things to say about the game but that's not helpful.  The concept is great, visuals are good enough but the execution needs a lot of work. 
The money balancing is really bad once you get a ways in.  You only profit around 1k per day whether you're level 20 or level 40 but any expansions at this point are 10k+.  It's just not fun when you just have to grind the same routine every day and rarely can afford upgrades.
It drives me absolutely bonkers that the sizes of the shelves, coolers, freezers, etc are not standardized or related to the room sizes.  It really should be more like every other game with tile snapping with free placement as a toggle option.  There no reason this shelf and that freezer should be a few "inches" different in width and oh now you have this gap in the corner where nothing fits.
The vehicles are terrible and pointless.  It's faster to run.
Get the game on sale and you can have a few hours of fun but it really sucks that I'm missing out over half the content of the game because I'm not willing to grind out a few hundred hours to unlock it.

i would get this game while its on sale, i got this game for 12 dollars and i first regretted it because its the type of game you play for a few hours ad the get bored like a  week minecraft phase but its for like 3 hours. i have kept my save everytime i come back though so im always making progression and not replaying the very beginning of the game but in the end this game really just feels like your working another job

Negative review, because of empty boxes. It should not be that complicated to begin with. Did you know that in real life you can stack empty boxes together, so you don't walk with just a single one like a f idiot?

1.1 is the first version I played
but this so-called 1.1 is so unpolished, just like an early access game.
lack of instructions, minor bugs, and some control glitches...
it feels like many places can be better if devs put some time into each of them

and a worse thing is that the game runs a 30% discount right after 2 days I purchased it.... 

I really like this kind of business simulation game. Luckily, I'm so late to buy this game, but unfortunately, it seems I'm too early to buy this too
